ref: 4150 *gāvuta ʻ a measure of distance ʼ. [MIA. gāvū˘ta -- (with early change of -- avv -- to -- āv -- before ū˘?) < gavyūta -- n. ʻ 2 krośas ʼ Pañcad., ʻ 1 krośa ʼ lex., gōyuta -- ʻ frequented by cattle ʼ R., ʻ 2 krośas ʼ MBh. Cf. gávyūti -- f. ʻ a pasture ʼ RV., gōy˚ Pāṇ. Vārtt., ʻ a measure of distance (= 2 krośas) ʼ MBh.: gṓ -- with yūti -- H. W. Bailey TPS 1954, 138 or gávya -- with ūtí -- EWA i 332]
Pa. gāvuta -- n. ʻ measure of distance (= 1/4 yojana or about 1 3/4 miles) ʼ,
Pk. gāū˘a -- , gāu -- n. ʻ 1 or 2 krośas ʼ,
S. g̠āū m. ʻ one kos ʼ;
H. gau m. ʻ four kos ʼ;
G. gāu m. ʻ one kos ʼ;
